data.title: Gombe State Governor Holds Expanded Security Council Meeting to Address Recent Protests – Progressive News
data.text:
In response to the recent violent protest on August 1, 2024, Governor Muhammadu Inuwa Yahaya of Gombe State convened an emergency expanded security meeting on Monday. This high-level gathering aimed to review the situation and devise a coordinated strategy to prevent future occurrences and ensure the safety of residents.

The meeting included heads of security agencies, relevant commissioners, local government chairmen, and traditional rulers. They focused on evaluating the security situation post-protest and implementing measures to maintain peace across the state.

Addressing the press after the meeting, Secretary to the State Government, Professor Ibrahim Abubakar Njodi, alongside Commissioner of Police Hayatu Usman and other security agency heads, detailed the deliberations. “The government recognizes that the protest was primarily driven by the current economic hardship. We are deeply concerned about the welfare of our citizens and are committed to addressing these issues promptly,” Njodi said.

To alleviate economic challenges, the government plans to distribute another round of food palliatives to vulnerable households, marking the 19th initiative of its kind. This effort aims to provide immediate relief and ensure that no resident goes hungry during these difficult times.

In response to public concerns about scrap material merchants, known as Bola-Jari, Governor Yahaya has directed the Attorney General and Commissioner for Justice, Barr. Zubair Muhammad Umar, to establish regulations for their activities. The council commended the security agencies for their swift intervention in managing the crisis and preventing further escalation.

Commissioner of Police Hayatu Usman reiterated the commitment of security agencies to maintaining law and order, assuring residents of their safety. “We are committed to ensuring the safety of lives and property. We urge all residents to cooperate with the authorities and refrain from any actions that could lead to violence or disruption,” he stated.

The CP revealed that several arrests were made in connection with the looting of public and private properties during the protests, with valuable items recovered. He urged those who lost property to visit the police headquarters to verify and reclaim their belongings.

The Gombe State Government’s proactive measures and Governor Yahaya’s exemplary leadership during this period highlight their dedication to ensuring the safety and well-being of all residents.
